name: Dad's Pan-Fried Green Beans
author: Pam Buffel
summary: Once upon a time, Dad received a similar recipe with a bundle of fresh green beans. He made the recipe once and then lost the card. After many attempts to recreate that flavor, he declares that this, his own recipe, is even better!
directions: Place the green beans in a large saucepan or pot with one inch of water
You may place them in a steamer insert if you have one
Bring to a boil, cover and cook for 5 minutes, they should still be firm and bright green
In a small bowl, stir together the soy sauce, balsamic vinegar and sugar; set aside
Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add garlic and cook until starting to brown
Add the green beans and stir to coat with the oil
Stir in the soy sauce mixture and simmer for a couple of minutes uncovered to reduce the sauce
Transfer the beans to a serving dish and pour the sauce over them
